job_title: Senior Associate Director in Waterville, ME

cons: Maximum annual pay increase is less than inflation, so your wage in real dollars decreases every year that you're there. This could help to explain the pretty high turnover I saw.

review_title: One of the best employers in Maine
pros: Colby College has an extremely professional and collaborative atmosphere. If you can get hired then you will find they have a very low turnover rate and tons of intra-campus advancement opportunities. The woman I replaced as an administrative assistant had been in the position for four years and went on to become an assistant director of a very large program.
cons: There is no training program whatsoever! As I was told on my first day, "it's sink or swim." However, that means that self-starters and ambitious people will have a ton of room to think outside the box, think for themselves, and find their own solutions to challenges. I couldn't be more happy here.

review_title: Educational support position that provides stability and great benefits
pros: I found this to be a very supportive, stable environment to work in. The staff provided thorough training based on the experience and expertise of the person who previously held this job. There was clear communication about priorities and the role of the position in the overall organization. The department culture was easy-going and team-oriented. There was room for lateral movement within different departments and divisions but not a lot of turnover. Work/life balance is valued highly and communicated clearly. The organization values the employees a great deal. Most people who are hired here stay for decades.
cons: The rate of pay for initial hires at the entry level is minimal. I found that some of my peers were working an additional job to meet the cost of living.

pros: Great benefits and people to work with.
cons: Many salaries do not keep up with industry standards. The only way to get a significant pay increase is to threaten to leave at which time you might be given a pay increase. Annual salary increases are meager around 1.5% for top-performers. I generally wouldn't complain, but there's a dichotomy when letters go out stating tuition costs are going up 5% to keep up with cost of living increases, but pay increases for workers are much below that.

review_title: Research Assistant - Colby College Psychology Department
pros:
• Take into consideration work-life balance of a college student, allowing for work-schedule flexibility - academics valued as top priority
• Professors are wonderful mentors and go above and beyond what is necessary - providing students with networking opportunities and resources
cons: • Can be hard to find a professor with matching research interests, as it is a small liberal arts college with a smaller faculty

review_title: Great and positive experience.  Highly recommend!
pros: Supportive faculty and engaging students.  Excellent way to make some side-money while still a student, as well as develop good communication skills and meet new people.
cons: Can be difficult to find times to meet given student's complicated schedules.  Pay scale remains the same regardless of experience.

pros: I worked with a great team, both at the Career Center in the athletic department.  Colby employees are dedicated to provide a world-class education and staff, faculty and administrators are committed to making sure liberal arts students are prepared to meet the challenges of the new world.
cons:
Pay.  

Colby did not offer competitive salaries for the work done.
